Based on the genre and preference cues you provided, here are some potential recommendations:

  * Title: Aladdin (1992) ) | Plot: What would you do if you were granted your greatest wish? How would that change you? Aladdin had the perfect life, loving parents, and his whole life ahead of him. But that all changed when he found himself living on the streets finding ways to survive each day. Even with the cards stacked against him, he stayed true to the Christian values instilled by his loving mother. Little did he know how a random act of kindness would change the course of his life forever. In one unexpected moment, Aladdin found himself face to face with the woman of his dreams. Too bad she was completely out of his league. Comedy and musical numbers ensue as their paths continue to cross. It is said that there is NO GREATER gift than love, but can their love survive the test? Be careful. Things are not always the way they seem.

Based on what you've mentioned, I would recommend "Gone with the Wind" and "Big Fish". 

"Gone with the Wind" is a classic epic film that follows the life of Scarlett O'Hara during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods. The movie features a talented cast including Academy Award-winning actress Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara, and Academy Award-winning actor Robert Redford as General Ulysses S. Grant. 

"Big Fish" is a romantic comedy film that follows the life of Jack Drum (played by Ewan McGregor) during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods. The movie features a talented cast including Academy Award-winning actress Jessica Lange as Ethel Drum, and Academy Award-winning actor John Travolta as Joe Drum. 

I hope these recommendations are helpful!

Based on the preferences provided, I would recommend "We the Living" by Ayn Rand.

This movie is about personal revolt against the collective, represented by the Red banners and slogans. The story follows three people who stand out with the mark of unconquered in their bearing: Kira, who wants to be a builder; the two men who love her - Leo, an aristocrat; Andrei, a Communist.

The movie offers an answer that challenges the modern conscience.
